Poetic Translation: Welcome, our Empress, Mother of tender sympathy:

Lyrics: Vita, dulcedo, et spes nostra, salve.
Direct Translation: Our life, sweetness, and hope, hail!
Poetic Translation: Our life, our sweetness, hope and promise, welcome.

Lyrics: Ad te clamamus, exsules, filii Hevae.
Direct Translation: To you we cry aloud, exiles, children of Eve.
Poetic Translation: To you we're crying, exiles and children of Eden.

Lyrics: Ad te suspiramus, gementes et flentes in hac lacrimarum valle.
Direct Translation: To you we send [our] sighs, groaning and weeping in this vale of tears.
Poetic Translation: To you we send sighing, our groaning and weeping from this dark and mournful valley.

Lyrics: Eia ergo, Advocata nostra, illos tuos misericordes oculos ad nos converte.
Direct Translation: Then, our Advocate, turn your compassionate eyes toward us.
Poetic Translation: Then, Advocate, you our staunch defender, turn your merciful eyes, turn your compassionate eyes, toward our sorrows.

Lyrics: Et Jesum, benedictum fructum ventris tui, nobis post hoc exsilium ostende.
Direct Translation: And, after this exile, show us Jesus, the blessed fruit of your womb.
Poetic Translation: And Jesus, of your womb the blessed fruit, now show us; show to us here our Lord after this exile.

Lyrics: O clemens: O pia: O dulcis Virgo Maria.
Direct Translation: O merciful: O holy: O sweet Virgin Mary.
Poetic Translation: O mercy: O holy: O sweetest Virgin Queen Mary.

Direct Translation: Stolba, K Marie, ed. The Development of Western Music: An Anthology. 3rd ed. Vol. I. Boston: McGraw-Hill, 1998. Print.
